page.title: 13HOUSES IN NASSINGTON.
page.content: We put the 254 houses in Nassington into 3 groups.These were (a) built before 1900 (b) built between 1900 and 1960 (c) built after 1960.There were 66 in group (a) 116 in group (b) 72 in group (c).The materials used in the oldest houses were limestone,Colly- weston slate,wood,pantiles,clay,thatch blue slate and cow dung!The Manor House and Prebendal House are the oldest in the village.All these materials were used to build them.The Prebendal House has a dovecot in its grounds.This is a limestone building with a tiled roof. It was used to breed doves for food. The houses built in groups (b) and (c) were built of breeze blocks,stone,stone coloured bricks,cement,cement tiles and wood.Building in the village must be stone coloured.No major regulations affect styles or materials.Outline permission exists for 110 new homes.
